required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Kinematics in Posterior Cruciate Retaining and Bi-Cruciate Retaining Total Knee Replacements Using Mobile Fluoroscopy
clinical_study.official_title: Kinematics in Posterior Cruciate Retaining and Bi-Cruciate Retaining Total Knee Replacements Using Mobile Fluoroscopy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to acquire kinematic in vivo fluoroscopy data using the University of Tennessee's tracking fluoroscopy system (TFS) from subjects who were implanted with the Smith & Nephew Journey II posterior cruciate retaining (PCR) total knee arthroplasty (TKA) or Journey II bi-cruciate retaining (BCR) TKA. CMR has previously collected data for the Smith & Nephew BCS TKA and compared these kinematics data to those of normal knees.

detailed_description.textblock: The objective for this study is to analyze the in vivo kinematics for subjects implanted with either a Journey II PCR or BCR TKA and compare those patterns to subjects having a normal knee from our previous study and to those patterns from subjects having a Smith & Nephew Journey II BCS TKA.

primary_outcome.description: Anterior Posterior (AP) translations of medial femoral condyles and translations of lateral femoral condyles during activity of walking up a ramp
Maximum weight-bearing flexion and axial rotation (AR) while walking up a ramp
Anterior Posterior (AP) translations of medial femoral condyles and translations of lateral femoral condyles during activity of walking down a ramp
Maximum weight-bearing flexion and axial rotation (AR) while walking down a ramp

primary_outcome.measure: Kinematics Translations during deep knee bend (DKB) activity
primary_outcome.description: Anterior Posterior (AP) translations of medial femoral condyles and translations of lateral femoral condyles during deep knee bend activity

primary_outcome.measure: Kinematics during deep knee bend activity
primary_outcome.description: Maximum weight-bearing flexion and axial rotation (AR) during deep knee bend activity

primary_outcome.measure: Kinematics Translations during squat to stand (S2S) activity
primary_outcome.description: Anterior Posterior (AP) translations of medial femoral condyles and translations of lateral femoral condyles during S2S activity
Maximum weight-bearing flexion and axial rotation (AR) during S2S activity

arm_group.arm_group_label: Smith & Nephew Journey II PCR TKA
arm_group.description: Subjects implanted with a Smith & Nephew Journey II posterior cruciate retaining total knee arthroplasty

arm_group.arm_group_label: Smith & Nephew Journey II BCR TKA
arm_group.description: Subjects implanted with a Smith & Nephew Journey II posterior bi-cruciate retaining total knee arthroplasty

intervention.intervention_name: Journey II posterior cruciate retaining total knee arthroplasty
intervention.arm_group_label: Smith & Nephew Journey II PCR TKA

intervention.intervention_name: Journey II posterior bi-cruciate retaining total knee arthroplasty
intervention.arm_group_label: Smith & Nephew Journey II BCR TKA

study_pop.textblock: Patients implanted with a Smith & Nephew Journey II posterior cruciate retaining (PCR) or a Smith & Nephew Journey II bi-cruciate retaining (BCR) total knee arthroplasty (TKA) implanted by Dr. Harold E. Cates.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Must have must either a Smith & Nephew Journey II PCR or BCR TKA
- Must be at least three months post-operative
- Must have a Knee Society score of >90 with no ligamentous laxity or pain
- Weigh 250 pounds or less
- Should have good-to-excellent post-operative flexion
- Must be able to perform activities (without aid of any kind) and without pain, walking up and down a ramp, performing a deep knee bend and rising from that kneeling position after the deep knee bend
- Must not have had other surgical procedures conducted within the past six months that will prohibit them from performing the study activities
- Must have body mass index (BMI) of less than 38
- Must be between 40-85 years of age
- Must be willing to sign the Informed Consent (IC) / HIPAA and PHI Release forms to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant, potentially pregnant or lactating females. To satisfy radiation protocol, each female subject will be asked if she is pregnant, or possibly could be pregnant. A pregnant person will not be allowed to participate in the study
- Subjects without the required types of knee implants
- Subjects who are unable to walk up and down a ramp, perform a deep knee bend or rising from that kneeling position without aid or support and without pain
- Subjects who have had other surgical procedures conducted within the past six months that will prohibit them from performing the study activities

facility.name: Tennessee Foundation for Education and Research
